stories.text: SAFEs are becoming more and more common for early staged startups in my country (NZ), for good reasons of course. However, our startup has raised multiple small priced rounds and our investors have pre-emptive rights on new share issues. It's super confusing how pre-emptive rights apply to SAFE notes if investors don't waive their pre-emptive rights. I can't find any examples online explaining how pre-emptives are applied to SAFEs. Would love to hear about anyones experience in this area :)
stories.title: Has anyone raised on a SAFE after doing a priced round?
The Tyrannical Mods of Stack Overflow

stories.text: Please help bring this to the top. This website is downright dangerous. It publishes addresses, phone numbers, names and more... without consent. You have the option to ask for data removal, but it asks for a photo ID! also after deletion, your data is added back in a few weeks. This is insane and no amount of GDPR fines has worked so far. This has to stop!
stories.title: Tell HN: Google seriously needs to delist LocateFamily.com
